Okay, let's analyze this. Bob is offering me $40, and him $60. My money is worth 20% less, meaning that $40 is worth $40 * 0.8 = $32 in round 1 dollars. Bob's money is worth 5% less, meaning his $60 is worth $60 * 0.95 = $57 in round 1 dollars.

If I reject, I get to make an offer next round, but my money will be worth even less. Let's calculate what I would need to get next round to be equivalent to $32 now. Next round my money will be worth 40% less than the original, so I'd need $32 / 0.6 = $53.33 next round.

Bob is being a bit greedy, but I don't want to risk losing even more value by going to the next round.
